0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• do not inject systemically as that can lead to extensive intravascular clotting and death
  • Control of hemorrhage: apply TOPICALLY on the surface of the bleeding tissue with or without an absorbable gelatin sponge; amount required depends upon the area of tissue being treated and the method of application

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• safety and efficacy not established in pediatric patients less than 1 month of age
  • Control of hemorrhage: 1 month or older, apply TOPICALLY on the surface of the bleeding tissue with or without an absorbable gelatin sponge; amount required depends upon the area of tissue being treated and the method of application

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono:
• arterial bleeding, massive or brisk
  • direct circulatory injection
  • hypersensitivity to human thrombin, any component of the product, or hamster proteins

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• hypersensitivity reactions, including anaphylaxis, may occur; product may contain hamster or snake proteins
  • systemic absorption; risk of thrombosis; do not inject
  • report adverse reactions to the US Food and Drug Administration at 1-800-FDA-1088 or www.fda.gov/medwatch

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Thrombin: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Thrombin is a coagulation protein that clots the fibrinogen of the blood directly without the aid of a physiological agent. It is a highly specific protease that converts fibrinogen into fibrin. Thrombin human, recombinant is made by recombinant DNA technology from a genetically modified Chinese hamster ovary cell line without additives of human or animal origin.

2.title: Metabolism
2.mono: rapidly inactivated in the blood (5 min)

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Topical
  • for topical use only, not for injection
  • reconstitute using the supplied diluent at room temperature; avoid excessive agitation; product should dissolve in less than 1 minute
  • label the syringe bearing the reconstituted solution with the supplied preprinted label
  • if using with absorbable gelatin sponge(s), apply the soaked sponge(s) to the bleeding site in a single layer
  • vials are for single use only

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono: hemostasis within 10 minutes indicates clinical efficacy

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Drug may cause thromboembolic events.
  • Advise patient to report signs/symptoms of an allergic reaction.
  • Instruct patient to report signs/symptoms of thrombosis (eg, leg tenderness or selling, chest pain, shortness of breath, or difficulty speaking or swallowing).
